# init(_:isOn:intent:)

**Initializer**

Creates a toggle performing an `AppIntent` and generates its label from a localized string key.

## Declaration

```swift
nonisolated init(_ titleKey: LocalizedStringKey, isOn: Bool, intent: some AppIntent)
```

## Parameters

- **titleKey**: The key for the toggleâ€™s localized title, that describes the purpose of the toggle.
- **isOn**: Whether the toggle is on or off.
- **intent**: The `AppIntent` to be performed.

## Discussion

This initializer creates a [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/Text] view on your behalf, and treats the localized key similar to [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/Text/init(_:tableName:bundle:comment:)]. See `Text` for more information about localizing strings.

To initialize a toggle with a string variable, use [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/Toggle/init(_:isOn:intent:)] instead.

## Creating a toggle for an App Intent

- **init(isOn:intent:label:)**: Creates a toggle performing an `AppIntent`.
